alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; Northeast Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 21 at 3:50AM MST until February 22 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A WINTER STORM ARRIVES THIS AFTERNOON INTO WEDNESDAY IMPACTING NORTHERN COLORADO... .A system will bring heavy snowfall across the Front Range starting in the higher elevations later this afternoon. Snow begins in the foothills and northern I-25 corridor starting late tonight. The heaviest snowfall will occur in Park Range and the Larimer county foothills. This will likely lead to periods of poor visibility and difficult travel conditions especially in the Colorado high country. Also look for slow travel for the morning and afternoon commutes on Wednesday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 8 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches with up to 12 inches in the foothills. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...The Northern Front Range Foothills, Fort Collins, and Briggsdale. * WHEN...From Midnight tonight to 8 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
